Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2008 09:47AM amy394 wrote: Hi - Just wanted to let you know you are not alone.  My case sounds very similar to yours. I had a suspicious mammo which showed microcalcifications and was sent for a mag image mammo. After the mag image, I was told by the radiologist that this appeared to be a malignancy and was sent for a core needle biopsy. The pathology results were sclerosing adenosis which the radiologist strongly disagreed with.  After being told by the surgeon (that the radiologist referred me to) that she would rather "wait and see what happens over the next year", I decided to go to the comprehensive breast center at Brigham and Women's Hospital.  B&W re-read my pathology slides and dx me with atypical hyperplasia and I underwent a wide opening excisional biopsy with wire localization this week, 9/29.  I am now waiting, not so patiently, for the results.   I would like to strongly suggest you trust your own instincts and be your own advocate.  If you have any doubts or questions that have gone unanswered, get a second opinion - preferably from a hospital that specializes in breast care.  Nobody cares as much about your health than you do!! Good luck my thoughts and prayers are with you. Amy

Posts.Content: amy394 wrote: I just joined the forum with hopes that someone can help me! I was called back in for mag image mammo on 08/08 due to microcalcifications found in the upper, outer area of my right breast.  Upon conclusion of the mag image mammo, the Dr. informed me that he was "highly suspicious" of a malignancy and assigned BIRADS 5. I was scheduled for, and had a stereotactic biopsy on 08/11 by a different Dr. The pathology results came back with a diagnosis of sclerosing adenosis.  Both radiologists are skeptical of the pathology results and they referred me to a surgeon for an excisional biopsy to rule out any possible malignancy.  Upon meeting the surgeon for the excisional biopsy consult, she told me she thought it would be best to NOT perform the excisional biopsy and wait 6 months to see if there are any changes to the area. I am scared to death that this could be a malignancy and I can't imagine waiting another 6 months to have a resolution to this. Has anyone had a similar diagnosis/misdiagnosis?   Log in to post a reply
